module_restrictions: Postgraduate modules are not open to undergraduate exchange students. Please see here for guidance on choosing modules: https://www.york.ac.uk/study/international/applying/visiting-students/courses/guidance-on-choosing-modules/
visa_info: UK Visa and Immigration updates their immigration policy regularly. It is the studentâ€™s responsibility to check on the requirements via their website before they leave for the exchange. For latest information on border control please see: https://www.gov.uk/uk-border-control
accommodations_info: As a visiting student, you are guaranteed accommodation if you have applied for your course place with Centre for Global Programmes by their stipulated deadlines. You can either live in an en-suite single bedroom or in a room with a wash basin and share a common bathroom. You can cook in a shared kitchen or eat in the dining rooms or snack-bars on campus. At each of the six colleges, there are common rooms, a bar, a television room, laundry, telephone facilities and a reception service. More information is available at http://www.york.ac.uk/about/departments/support-and-admin/accommodation/
cost_of_living: The estimated monthly living expenses can be found at https://www.york.ac.uk/students/housing-and-money/financial-support/budgeting/budgets/.
